results.title: Where my heart lies
results.creator_credit: Vicki Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vicki Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.

results.title: In memory of Mark and Dusty
results.creator_credit: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.

results.title: I spell I can't...I can!
results.creator_credit: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.

results.title: Days of clear water
results.creator_credit: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Emma describes her life growing up with her nan, an independent lady who loved to tend to her garden and go for walks along the river. When her nan passed away, Emma lost not only her nan but her best friend.

results.title: A Little bit of willpower
results.creator_credit: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kicked out of home at the age of 15 and struggling with depression, Leanda Bunn still managed to complete her VCE, find accommodation and be independent thanks to a few very special people in her life and a lot of willpower.

results.title: Artist: unknown
results.brief_description:
Being a struggling artist is tough at the best of times but when you’re thousands of miles from home, your debts are mounting and you’re making no money, something’s got to give.
Amy made the long trip from Australia to London to paint. The rent on her workspace is now a month overdue, the landlord is knocking and working part-time in a cafe is not making ends meet. She could try selling her work - but that would entail showing people.
Shot on location in London with original music by Horse Stories. Produced, directed and written by Catherine Green.

results.title: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?
results.creator_credit: Darfur Australia Network and Infinite Films
results.brief_description:
This documentary has been produced to raise awareness about the continuing tragedy in the Darfur region of Western Sudan and build solidarity between the Australian people and the people of Darfur.
The conflict in Darfur has been continuing for more than three years, has resulted in the deaths of more than 400,000 civilians, the displacement of at least 2.5 million people and there are currently 3.5 million people dependent upon insufficient international humanitarian aid. Darfur is in crisis and the genocide has to stop.
The film includes footage from refugee camps in Darfur, artwork and music from a range of local artists, and the perceptions of a range of influential Australians as to why Australians should make NOISE for Darfur.
results.title_for_label: NOISE on film: noise for Darfur = Why should Australians make noise for Darfur?

results.title: Queenscliff beaches; Our journey
results.creator_credit: Paul Jones and Queenscliff Primary School
results.brief_description:
This film is a learning outcome from the “Beaches” group student led investigation program at Queenscliff Primary School. It was undertaken as part of the 2007 Snapshots of Remote Communities Project and was overall winner of the Annual Sprockets and Flares Multimedia Awards.
A combination of softwares including Blue Sky technologies and artwork by the students was used in the creation of this work.
Two versions are included:
1. Queenscliff beaches - final product
2. Our journey - details the behind-the-scenes and process
